result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Johnathan Kattelman

records.addlTxt: Email sent to Douglas Co jail, def is set up to appear by zoom on Dec 19;  ka

10:03 AM Defendant Joseph Johnathan Kattelman appeared by video, in custody from Douglas County.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Joseph Johnathan Kattelman.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF113, 22CF119, 22CF171, 22CM63, 22CM86, and 22CM95.  22CF171 here for prelim hearing and all other cases are here for STC.  All parties agree.  
22CF171 - Atty going ahead with prelim hearing.  State calls witness Officer Jonathan Kroll, sworn in, questioned.  Witness identifies def.  State has filed exhibit for bail jumping, asking to admit.  Proposed exhibit admitted.  Atty questions witness.  No redirect.  Court finds PC that a crime was committed in Ashland County, case is bound over for arraignment.  State filing information now, mirrors the criminal charges in complaint.  Atty - reviewed charges, waives reading, pleads NG to each count, noted.  All cases STC at next hearing.  Atty- brought motion for reconsideration of bond at last hearing, asking for NC dropped.  Court states to file a motion.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Def is set up to appear by zoom for court on October 20 from Douglas Co;  ka

10:16 AM Defendant Joseph Johnathan Kattelman appeared by video, in custody from Douglas County.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Joseph Johnathan Kattelman.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Cases 22CF113, 22CF119, 22CF171, 22CM63, 22CM86, and 22CM95.  22CF171 is here for initial appearance, 22CF119 here for arraignment, 22CF113 here for prelim hearing, remaining cases here for STC.  Atty regarding in 22CF171 Atty will represent.  
22CF113 - State calls witness SGT Albertus, sworn in, State questions.  Record reflects the def is identified.   Atty questions witness.  Court finds PC that a felony was committed case is bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information now, contains same counts as complaint.  
22CF113 def waives reading of information, NG entered, noted.  22CF119, waives reading, recv'd complaint NG entered, noted.  
22CF171 - Atty has copy of complaint.  Atty and def in break out room to discuss complaint/charges.  Back on the record at 10:39.  Atty discussed asking for prelim hearing, waives reading, understands charges.  10/20 at 1000 am for prelim.  
Motion to modify bail in cases.  Atty comments.  Pertains to NC.  Court denies motion.  Request of 22CF171 to be reduced cash bail, court denies motion.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
to Modify Bond

2:11 PM Defendant Joseph Johnathan Kattelman appeared by video, in custody from .  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Joseph Johnathan Kattelman.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF113, 22CF119, 22CM63, 22CM86, and 22CM95.  Motion to modify bond filed.  State opposes the motion.  22CM63 NC with J.C. arises from this case.  Atty comments on motion.  Court denies motion.  Atty will take new case, that def was picked up on.  Court orders $3000 cash bail on New Charges.  Initial appearance for new charges can happen with the STC on the pending cases and prelim.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:35 AM Defendant Joseph Johnathan Kattelman in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Joseph Johnathan Kattelman.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF113, 22CF119, 22CM63, 22CM86, and 22CM95.  Atty, was not able to reach out to def, just received working phone number from def prior to court.  Def and Atty in break out room.  Back on the record at 9:45.  Atty, in CM cases pleads NG, noted.   
22CF113 asking for a prelim hearing waives time limits, in 22CF119 waives prelim hearing in this case.  Def waiving time limits and prelim hearing, understands rights giving up, Atty satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver for prelim hearing in 22CF119, PC reviewed finds a felony was committed in Ashland County bound over for arraignment.  Arraignment at same time as prelim hearing and other cases as STC to track along.  State filing information now.  Def can appear by zoom with stipulation to identity.  Atty request for modification of bond requesting a hearing date, court sees no request.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Attorney Ruth Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 22CF113, 22CM63, 22CF119, 22CM86 and 22CM95.  Files contain a report from SPD office looking for an attorney.  State has not seen motion from def on motion to modify bail.  Def comments on that motion.  Court motion is denied.  Def sanction is till 8/20/22.

Minutes Scanned.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
